results.headline: They’re Buddies, but as Coarse as the War Around Them

results.headline: From Selfish Slob to Sex God
results.summary_short: In “Summer of Blood,” an offensive and unattractive young man finds his dating life transformed by an encounter with a vampire.

results.headline: Hijacking the News
results.summary_short: In Simon Brand’s film “Default,” created from found footage, a pirate who wants to be called “terrorist” makes an unusual proposition.

results.headline: When Good Cops Do Bad Things

results.headline: Prisoner and Guard, Cautiously Bonding in a Limitless Hellhole

results.headline: Paris Wasn’t Burning: A Look at Why Not
results.summary_short: Volker Schlöndorff’s “Diplomacy” imagines an evening’s conversation that saved Paris from being blown up by a retreating Nazi army in 1944.

results.headline: A Wife Addicted to Lust, No Matter the Cost
results.summary_short: “Addicted,” a film by Bille Woodruff, is a cautionary tale of a restless businesswoman who seems to have it all but descends into sex addiction.

results.headline: First a Tremor, Then a Wheelchair, Then Some Tougher Choices
results.summary_short: Hilary Swank plays a pianist who has amyotrophic lateral sclerosis in “You’re Not You.”

results.headline: Thou Shall Help Others, Maybe

results.headline: Drill Sergeant in the Music Room
